Explanation: The doctor suggested an X-ray of the lumbar spine, which aligns with the criteria of checking for fractures and other structural abnormalities in the lower back.
The doctor suggested an MRI of the lumbar spine, which aligns with the need to assess for soft tissue injuries such as herniated discs or nerve compression.
The doctor did not suggest any blood tests or similar investigations to rule out underlying infections or inflammatory conditions contributing to the back pain.
The doctor did not suggest a specific neurological assessment as part of the physical examination, which is necessary to evaluate for signs of nerve involvement.
